cease.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: to stop doing something or stop happening
cease.translation[0].definitions[0].note: cease fire! (=used to order soldiers to stop shooting)
cease.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: The rain ceased and the sky cleared.
The company ceased production at their Norwich plant last year.
He ceased to be a member of the association.
The things people will do for charity never cease to amaze me (=I am always surprised by them).
the decision to cease using CFCs in packaging
cease.translation[0].definitions[0].note: In everyday English, people usually use stop rather than cease:
They have stopped using CFCs in packaging.
The rain stopped just as the fireworks began.
